title: Mean Reversion with Bollinger Bands
content:
# Bollinger Bands Strategy

Bollinger Bands consist of a middle band (N-period SMA) and two outer bands (N-period SMA +/- K * standard deviations).

## Mean Reversion Logic
- Prices tend to return to the mean.
- **Buy Signal**: When price touches or crosses below the lower band (oversold).
- **Sell Signal**: When price touches or crosses above the upper band (overbought).

Standard settings: 20-day SMA, 2 standard deviations.
code:
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

# Mock Data
dates = pd.date_range(start='2020-01-01', periods=200)
price = pd.Series(np.cumsum(np.random.randn(200)) + 100, index=dates)

# Calculate Bollinger Bands
period = 20
std_dev_multiplier = 2

sma = price.rolling(window=period).mean()
std = price.rolling(window=period).std()

upper_band = sma + (std * std_dev_multiplier)
lower_band = sma - (std * std_dev_multiplier)

# Generate Signals
signals = pd.DataFrame(index=price.index)
signals['price'] = price
signals['buy'] = np.where(price < lower_band, 1, 0) # Buy when price < lower
signals['sell'] = np.where(price > upper_band, 1, 0) # Sell when price > upper

print("Buy Signals:")
print(signals[signals['buy'] == 1].head())
